duck: Randomness - Randomness means different things in various fields.
trademark distinctiveness - Trademark distinctiveness is an important concept in the law governing trademarks and service marks.

Arbitration - Arbitration, a form of alternative dispute resolution, is a technique for the resolution of disputes outside the courts, where the parties to a dispute refer it to one or more persons, by whose ...
arbitrariness definition: depending on individual discretion (as of a judge) and not fixed by law.
Arbitrariness is a term given to choices and actions subject to individual will, judgment or preference, based solely upon an individual's opinion or discretion.

wiki.text:
'Arbitrariness' is a term given to choices and actions subject to individual
will, judgment or preference, based solely upon an individual's opinion or discretion.<ref>[[Merriam-
Webster's Dictionary]] (2009)</ref><ref>[[Oxford English Dictionary]]
(1989)</ref>

Arbitrary decisions are not necessarily the same as random decisions. For
example, during the 1973 oil crisis, Americans were allowed to purchase gasoline
only on odd-numbered days if their license plate was odd, and on even-numbered
days if their license plate was even. The system was well-defined and not random
in its restrictions; however, since license plate numbers are completely
unrelated to a person's fitness to purchase gasoline, it was still an arbitrary
division of people. Similarly, schoolchildren are often organized by their
surname in alphabetical order, a non-random yet still arbitrary method, at least
in cases where surnames are irrelevant.
wiki.title: Arbitrariness
